thread.title: Australia cricket: Steve Smith completes captain s ton against India in Pune - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Australia cricket: Steve Smith completes captain s ton against India in Pune - Yahoo7

author: Rob Forsaith
title: Australia cricket: Steve Smith completes captain s ton against India in Pune - Yahoo7
text:
Share Australia cricket: Steve Smith completes captain s ton against India in Pune - Yahoo7 The showdown between skippers Steve Smith and Virat Kohli was billed as the battle that will all but decide Australia's bid for a boilover in India. Close Steve Smith's incredible century on Day Three UP NEXT VIDEO Steve Smith's incredible century on Day Three. Source: 7 Sport Steve Smith's incredible century on Day Three 
It's far too early to suggest Australia will record the nation's second Test series win in India since 1970, but Smith's century in Pune has left them incredibly well placed to complete their first Test win in India since 2004. 
Smith posted his 10th - and arguably most important - Test ton as captain of Australia on day three of the absorbing contest. 
"That's as good a Test hundred as he's scored in his career to date. Australia are in an extremely dominant position because of that innings," former Australian captain Michael Clarke said on Star Sports. Smith's century was one of his gutsiest. Pic: AAP 
"No matter what conditions are or where he is in the world, he adapts and finds a way. This innings has been very important in the context of not only this Test but the series." 
India's sloppy fielding also helped. Kohli struggled to contain his rage as Smith was dropped on 23, 29, 37 and 67. Jayant Yadav missed a chance to run the skipper out on 60. 
Kohli and his teammates also straddled the line of dissent after a couple of confident appeals were turned down, including when Smith should have been given out lbw on 73. Close India drop four catches on day two UP NEXT VIDEO India drop four catches on day two. Source: Fox Sports India drop four catches on day two 
The Decision Review System (DRS) is being used but Kohli, who has a history of on-field verbal spats with Smith, had already unsuccessfully used both referrals. 
"That's why you have reviews," Clarke quipped after Kohli all but questioned Richard Kettleborough's not-out verdict after Matthew Wade edged one to the keeper. 
It capped a poor couple of days for Kohli, who was dismissed for his first Test duck at home and criticised by locals for taking the second new ball on day one when Mitchell Starc was teeing off. Close Renshaw throws up after nasty knock UP NEXT VIDEO Renshaw throws up after nasty knock. Source: Fox Sports Renshaw throws up after nasty knock 
Kohli's 19-Test undefeated streak is now under immense threat, likewise India's 20-Test undefeated run at home. 
Smith's tenure as captain started in the absence of an injured Clarke, when he tallied four hundreds and 769 runs at 128.16 against India in 2014/15. 
The 27-year-old, who has matured since becoming the nation's youngest Test captain since Kim Hughes, has produced higher scores and far better looking innings than his milestone in Pune. 
But he has rarely had to fight so hard for every run. Smith was in his element as he hammered home Australia's advantage on a spinner's paradise produced with the world's two best bowlers in mind. 
Star spinners Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja both had their moments against the classy right-hander, with the latter finally dismissing him after 260 minutes at the crease. 
Smith celebrated heartily upon reaching three figures. It was his 18th Test hundred, but the roar had more to do with the captain's desperation to snap a nine-Test losing streak in Asia. Close O'Keefe takes six as Aussies build big lead UP NEXT
